perturbation.original_text:
5.3 AUDIT RIGHTS. i-Escrow shall keep for one (1) year proper
records and books of account relating to the
computation of advertising payments owed to
2TheMart (including, as appropriate, the
computation of the size of average
Transaction).  Once every twelve (12)
months, 2TheMart through a CPA may inspect
and audit such records to verify reports.
Any such inspection will be conducted in a
manner that does not unreasonably interfere
with i-Escrow's business activities and with
no less than fifteen (15) days notice.
i-Escrow shall within two (2) weeks make any
overdue payments disclosed by the audit.
Such inspection shall be at 2TheMart's
expenseÍ¾ however, if the audit reveals
overdue payments in excess of ten percent
(10%) of the payments owed to date, i-Escrow
shall immediately pay all cost of such
audit.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.3 AUDIT RIGHTS. i-Escrow shall keep for six (6) months proper
records and books of account relating to the
computation of advertising payments owed to
2TheMart (including, as appropriate, the
computation of the size of average
Transaction).  Once every eighteen (18)
months, 2TheMart through a CPA may inspect
and audit such records to verify reports.
Any such inspection will be conducted in a
manner that does not unreasonably interfere
with i-Escrow's business activities and with
no less than thirty (30) days notice.
i-Escrow shall within thirty (30) days make any
overdue payments disclosed by the audit.
Such inspection shall be at i-Escrow's
expense; however, if the audit reveals
overdue payments in excess of five percent
(5%) of the payments owed to date, 2TheMart
shall immediately pay all cost of such
audit.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a record-keeping period of one year with audits occurring every twelve months, whereas the modified text specifies a record-keeping period of six months with audits occurring every eighteen months. This discrepancy creates ambiguity regarding the duration for which i-Escrow must retain financial records and the frequency of audits, impacting the ability to verify the accuracy of advertising payments. Additionally, the inspection cost allocation is reversed depending on overdue payments and the percentage amount is also changed.

perturbation.original_text:
8.1 TERM.  The term of this Agreement shall continue for
one (1) year following the Launch Date, unless earlier
terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be
renewed for any number of successive one (1)
year terms by mutual written agreement of
the parties prior to the conclusion of the
term of this Agreement.  A party wishing to
renew this Agreement shall give the other
party notice thereof no less than thirty
(30) days before the expiration of the term
then in effect.  In the event that either
party does not give such notice, the term of
this Agreement shall be automatically
renewed for another one (1) year.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.1 TERM.  The term of this Agreement shall continue for
two (2) years following the Launch Date, unless earlier
terminated as provided herein. This Agreement may be
renewed for a maximum of two successive six (6)
month terms with no written agreement of
the parties required prior to the conclusion of the
term of this Agreement.  A party wishing to
renew this Agreement shall give the other
party notice thereof no less than fifteen
(15) days before the expiration of the term
then in effect.  In the event that either
party does not give such notice, the term of
this Agreement shall not be automatically
renewed.
perturbation.explanation: The original agreement states the term is one year with renewal possible for successive one-year terms via written agreement, and also states that it will automatically renew if no notice is given, but the modified version changes it to two-year terms with renewals possible for a maximum of two six-month terms with no written agreement needed, and no automatic renewal. This directly contradicts the original term and renewal process and creates uncertainty about the actual length of the contract and how it can be extended.

perturbation.original_text:
11. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION.  A party's "Confidential Information"
is defined as any confidential or proprietary
information of a party which is disclosed to
the other party in a writing marked
confidential or, if disclosed orally, is
identified as confidential at the time of
disclosure and is subsequently reduced to a
writing marked confidential and delivered to
the
other party within ten (10) days of
disclosure.  Each party shall hold the other
party's Confidential Information in
confidence and shall not disclose such
Confidential Information to third parties
nor use the other party's Confidential
Information for any purpose other than as
required to perform under this Agreement.
Such restrictions shall not apply to
Confidential Information which (a) is
already known by the recipient, (b) becomes,
through no act or fault of the recipient,
publicly known, (c) is received by recipient
from a third party without a restriction on
disclosure or use, or (d) is independently
developed by recipient without reference to
the Confidential Information.  The
restriction on disclosure shall not apply to
Confidential Information which is required
to be disclosed by a court or government
agency. Upon expiration or termination of
this Agreement, within fourteen (14) days of
the other party's request, each party will
return all Confidential Information and
other deliverables to the requesting party.
perturbation.changed_text:
11. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION.  A party's "Confidential Information"
is defined as any information disclosed by one party to the other, regardless of whether it's marked confidential or identified as such orally. Each party shall make reasonable efforts to hold the other
party's Confidential Information in
confidence and may disclose such
Confidential Information to third parties if they deem it necessary or beneficial for their business operations.
Such restrictions shall only not apply to
Confidential Information which (a) is
already known by the recipient, (b) becomes,
through the fault of the recipient, publicly known, (c) is received by recipient
from a third party with restriction on
disclosure or use, or (d) is independently
developed by recipient with reference to
the Confidential Information.  The
restriction on disclosure shall apply to
Confidential Information which is required
to be disclosed by a court or government
agency. Upon expiration or termination of
this Agreement, each party is permitted to keep all Confidential Information and
other deliverables.
perturbation.explanation: The original section defines confidential information narrowly, requiring written marking or oral identification followed by written confirmation within ten days. The modified section broadens this to include any information, eliminating the marking requirement, while also weakening the obligation to protect confidential information by allowing disclosure if deemed 'necessary or beneficial.' Moreover, conditions b and c are changed, and the modified term allows parties to keep confidential information upon termination, which is a change in direction from the text.
